section.title: Adding embedded items
section.para: Some properties are items itself, so we can choose to add them as plain properties or to create a new itemtype block.
What's the difference? When you add a new block, you have access to all of its (and its parent) properties, so you can add much more information rather than adding a simple attribute.
Let's continue with the previous example, your final text should be this:
section.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954) Science fiction Trailer
section.para: The director section has a lot of unstyled information: name, surname and date of birth, so let's turn them into a machine-readeable format. But first of all we need to do a little change: convert the <span> element into a <div>.

example.title: Prepare your "Director" block
example.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954)
Science fiction Trailer

section.para:
Now select
Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954)
and select the director attribute. You can choose to add it as property or to create a new itemtype block: select the latter one and apply it to the current element.
Great! Now you're ready to style everything inside the director property!

example.title: Creating an embedded itemtype
example.programlisting:
Avatar

Director: James Cameron (born August 16, 1954)
Science fiction Trailer

section.para: Select James Cameron and add the name property (you can find it under the Type node). Remember to wrap the text with a new span element.
After that select August 16, 1954. As you can see, it's James Cameron birthdate, let's style it.

Select the birthDate property: things are quite different, this time. Infact we have to convert this text into a standard time format, so let's input 1954-08-16 in the List of possible Values, leaving the hour/minutes field blank.

note.para: You have to input the time using this format: YYYY-MM-DD

tip.para: There is a small datepicker next to the field, you can use it instead of typing the date manually.

section.title: Congratulations! (again)
section.para: Congratulations! You have styled your text block using Schema.org dictionary.

You have converted a lot of information into a machine-readable format:
First of all, you specified that we're talking about a movie
Its name is Avatar and it's a Science fiction film
You added the position of its trailer video
James Cameron (born in August 16th, 1954) is its director

As you can see, even a small text like this could be enriched with a lot more details. Even if we consider them obious, we just defined the context of the article without any doubt, and search engines bot will thank us.
